intro: Boechera perennans subsp. sanluisensis, commonly known as the San Luis blueweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has basal leaves that are pinnately lobed and stems that are often hairy. Boechera perennans subsp. sanluisensis is noted for its ecological importance in supporting pollinators and its role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat.
